intro: Cyclosorus attenuatus, commonly known as the slender water clover, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its floating leaves that are divided into four lobes, resembling a clover leaf. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds and lakes. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into seed pods. Cyclosorus attenuatus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small aquatic life.
